data.title: Drinks are so good! And good awesome too!
data.text: But they get very busy and it gets very crowded on weekends so in the bar very crowded and loud.  But food is amazing and drinks are very good as well and so is the guacamole best I have had!  Service a bit lacking though that is the main bummer of going to this restaurant.

data.title: Fish Taco's
data.text: Stopped and had Fish Taco's. Were they the best I have ever had (NO) but they were pretty close. You decide, if you like fish taco's like I do I suggest you try them out.

data.title: Decent food
data.text: We had dinner here with some friends and I must admit that I wasn't overly impressed.  The food tasted fine but it is more expensive than some other local Mexican restaurants and the portions were smaller.  The salsa had a good little heat to it which I don't tolerate very well anymore but it was good.

data.title: nice local  place
data.text: Easy walking distance to us.  Entrees not our favorite- sauce not to our liking. But happy hour choices and drinks are great.  Took friends from Green Bay to watch the football game with their team.  nice evening.

data.title: Strong Start, Weak Finish
data.text: Went with a girlfriend for Happy hour and we were initially impressed by the service! No one walked by our table without stopping to see if we needed anything. There was also someone constantly circulating with a tray of chips and salsa. We ordered our drinks, then food, then a second round of drink and then....we waited. And waited. And waited...a little over 45 min went by with absolutely no acknowledgement from anyone. We finally flagged someone down to check on our food order which we found had not even been entered in the first place. He asked if we wanted another round while we waited, we had nothing better to do so we said yes. Drinks took over ten minutes to arrive and they were wrong. The bartender fixed them and apologized for "still learning things" despite the fact she had made 2 rounds exactly the same prior. Food finally showed up after waiting almost an hour and a half. Service was pretty much non-existent by this point. Will not be returning.

data.title: Great Lunch in Gresham
data.text: Stopped here while traveling south from Seattle with my toddler and husband. We all had great meals. The location is good and safe to park. The restaurant was clean. The food was quick. Large tvs in the bar area to at sports. My Cabernet and gluten free and dairy free shrimp fajita were great. Would stop here again.

data.title: Lots to eat
data.text: They have lots of variety and their salsa while a tad runny is very flavorful. Everything we tried was very good. Would go out of my way to go again. Not just your run of the mill Mexican they have some flavorful surprises on the food and drink menu.

data.title: Good chunky Guacamole
data.text: We ate here our first night in the area after a very long day of flying. Upon walking in, a drunk patron came out and knocked me down. The experience got better after that. The guac was really good. I also ordered seafood enchilada's that were filled with plenty of seafood. The beans were creamy and tasty and those that had the rice said it was good too. They offer salsa and pico with chips. I would return to this restaurant again if I'm ever in the area.

data.title: Jumbo margaritas!
data.text: Went for a bday dinner.  Ordered large margaritas...glasses are the size of a small swimming pool!! lol  Good flavor choice, and if you are having a hard time deciding on a flavor, you can order a sampler with 4 different flavors!  Food was pretty good too!

data.title: Great place for happy hour
data.text:
There was a great selection for drinks. They had very interesting names which made it even more fun ordering them. I must say my favorite would have to be the rubber ducky which your drink came in a plastic shaped tub and a rubber ducky floating on top! I thought it was a creative twist to the drink scene that you don't see often.

I did order some food. We had the Mexican pizza, a burrito and the fajita quesadilla. The portion for the happy hour size was descent and the food taste pretty good. The food menu was pretty massive and I couldn't really decide what to eat. I just stuck to my fajita quesadilla and ordering different drinks and shots. They do give you chips and salsa as soon as you sit down which kept us occupied during the waiting times.

The time of my visit it wasn't too busy which in turn the waiter was very attentive.

data.title: Overpriced and just so-so
data.text: The menu is massive, way too many options to make me think that anything would really be very good.  I ordered a basic chicken fajita burrito.  This should have been a $10 item, tops, and was a few dollars more.  Then it came.  A server brought our meals out on the bottom shelf of the push cart that bus boys use to clear dirty dishes.  So strange, especially when the restaurant gives an air of being upscale.  The rice in the burrito was reminiscent of rice a roni, and the chicken may have been boiled, no real seasoning to it.  Even the chips were stale and over salted.

data.title: Modern Mexican American Standards done OK
data.text:
Rice and Bean Mexican American joint..... Take taqueria standard fare, then add rice and beans. That's about what you got here...  A simple taqueria type food selection in a restaurant.

It's a nice big place with a large bar area. Big TV's and the like....eh. The Coors light signs in the front window where kind of turn off. I like my Mexican Restaurants to look and feel Mexican, even if kitschy.

Service was adequate but rushed. Food was rushed.

Appetizers were standard Mexican American restaurant fare.  The few we had were a little better than average.

The menu is SAFE..... there's nothing outside of the basic popular standards. Carne asada.. tacos, burritos, plates.  Pick you meat and they'll have it in your favorite wrapper. Al PAstor, Carnitas, Pollo, Shrimp, etc. Nothing outside this realm... To me these are very basic fare. No moles or anything that branches out. Textbook American style Mexican menu.

Seafood selections had a little more variety...

Basically, this menu could have been from 1985....

Prices were way out of bounds... $12 for burrito. Most plates were above $12 bucks for  what you could get a better taqueria for $7.

Plates arrive HOT..... Food is warm.  That says volumes! Basically, for those who don't know, that means it's not made fresh, it's reheated in a plate. 

How did it all taste?  Shredded Beef had decent flavor but dry.  Tortillas looked to be pre-packaged, as did the Tortilla chips. The SINGLE salsa selection was Ok, but rather boring. Rice that appears in dishes is cooked well, but lacked any flavor definition. Refried beans tasted like Rosarita. So far, it looks like Mexican Night at the Jones house. Safeway could have catered this, so far.

We passed on the over priced seafood/shrimp dishes. $15 for Shrimp cocktail?  No ceviche.... if so, I'm sure it would have been $16 or above.  I can get good ceviche for $5 at a favorite taqueria.

Al Pastor sauce/marinade was pretty good. I could taste the achiote (Annatto) but the pineapple rings from a can really brought the sense of quality down.  I understand the use of pineapple juice in the Al PAstor, but we don't really need to look at teh pineapple, this is isn't a canned ham from grandma kitchen or Betty Crocker of the 50's.
;-)

The Chili verde was very well balanced in flavor.... Once again, SAFE and simple, but had a decent base flavor. The Pork was the prize of the night, well seasoned and cooked to a juicy tender perfection.

The word authentic really can't be used in this review... "New Mexican American standards" would be more appropriate.

Would I go back? Sure.... if I was hungry and so happen to be in the area. I wouldn't go out of my way to go there...

data.title: Good South of the Border Food
data.text: A creative, Mexican style restaurant.  I would recommend anything off the menu.  The margaritas are a good bet.  Nice bar area for lite eating and drinking.  Would recommend to lovers of Mexican food with a creative license.

data.title: Good enough
data.text: We were tired and hungry, just wanted to get out of rain and sit in a booth, which they provided.  Chips and salsa were just ok, staff was friendly. Our food was good but pretty average.  Prices were a little high for what it was. There's an extensive drinks menu and very large bar.  Waiter really tried to upsell us on the extras like beverages, appetizers and guacamole.  I had a very large taco salad and my little guest had a tiny little enchilada kids meal that was way overpriced. Music was loud club/rap type which was just annoying.  It wasn't bad, but next time I'll go to one of the many other (and far better in my opinion) restaurants in the quaint little area of downtown Gresham.  When we left a little after 5 there were all these young girls in super short red dresses, high heels and tons of makeup arriving, looking like they were going out clubbing.  I thought there must be a Christmas party, but realized they were employees.  They're trying for a party scene, but it was just cheezy.

data.title: great extended family mexican night (when we'd had enough turkey thxgiving leftovers)
data.text:
This was a new place for my family to try and we would definitely return.  The food was good and fresh-made.  Our family of 10 includes a vegetarian and a gluten free eater and everyone had something they enjoyed.  They even offer vegan alternatives.  The food is not the typical traditional Mexican with tons of cheese on everything and seems much healthier (but still very very tasty).  You've GOT TO TRY the guacamole!

The atmosphere was great for our family (including kids) but would also be a great gathering place for any age category.  They had some very fun drinks and a pretty good beer menu.

data.title: Great Mexican food and drinks
data.text:
We've dined at Mojave three times now and every time has been exceptional. Our standards for Mexican are high having spent many years in Tucson, and Mojave hits the mark. the grilled fish tacos in particular. Paired with a happy hour margarita ($5 for a large, tasty drink) and its not long before you're back on the beach at San Carlos. They carry Corralejo.

The owner is friendly and helpful, the space is modern and clean. Gresham is a small town but this is one of several high quality restaurants that makes a trip in my 62 Chevy even more fun.

data.title: Good happy hour place
data.text:
They have a good Happy Hour menu and the drinks are good.
There are lot's of room in the bar with sports showing on many TV's.  Fun place!.

data.title: A wide variety of flavors for your pallet
data.text: Plenty of great dishes at reasonable prices for you to sample. Good selection of beer on tap along with good mixed drinks to quench your thirst. I like the assorted sampler platter with a cold Corona while watching the sporting events on the multiple wide screen tvs

data.title: Its all about beginning and end of the meal.YOU HAVE TO FINISH the experience as that is what we the guest remember.
data.text:
We went on a Saturday evening, early.  Lots of young well dressed women in lots of makeup greeted us and sat us at a table. The light on the wall was very bright, we unscrewed the bulb.  The salsa was good, the chips were cold and very average.  Our waitress took our drink order, neglecting to tell us that the "large margarita" was about a quart.  
Our meal was ok, nothing spectacular, definitely gringo Mexican.  Had to ask for cilantro and lime for fajitas and the cilantro that was brought out was about a teaspoon.  
Once our meal was brought out, we didn't see our waitress again until our plates were removed.  We ordered a desert to go, she brought us our ticket, we left our credit card, it was run and then we waited and waited and waited. We asked about our desert 3 times and she kept saying oh, its about ready to come out. A piece of chocolate cake should not take 30 minutes to come out.  We finally got up at 25 minutes and went to the hostess desk and asked that our desert be refunded as it still had not come out.  The waitress saw us and asked about it and we said we were leaving, that waiting 30 minutes for a to go piece of cake was ridiculous.  She went back to the kitchen brought our piece of cake and then offered a $10 gift certificate.  REALLY????
A dining experience is always about the FINISH. Don't leave guests hanging, don't have them wait to a piece of cake to go, don't have them have to ask for things.  BAD DEAL.  
they may look fashionable but they have not figured out how to really make the guest experience worth a second trip.  Don't be swayed by the bright orange and black outfits.  Lots of tattoos showing and makeup galore.
We will likely not use the "gift certificate"
We really just wanted our cake refunded. Our dinner was ok, nothing WOW or authentic.  The price was too much. the margarita was $13!!! 
Not a local type hangout.

YOU HAVE TO FINISH the experience.  That is what the guest remembered.

data.title: Great neighborhood spot
data.text: Overall, the staff is great. Which is half the dining experience for me. Very friendly and they hustle. The food is good, not great. Not very creative, but what one would expect from Americanized Mexican food. Good beverage selection. The food and drink prices are a bit high. Great room, good energy. Multiple TV monitors that broadcast sports programming. I recommend.
